title: I would like to have Firefox as my Primary Browser on my Andriod device and my Windows 7 PC.
content: I am sick and tired of Microsoft and their statements like, "Windows 7 is no longer supported". Now Google has joined them with same thing. I do NOT see Firefox doing the same thing. Probably because they are NOT tied to the functionality that Microsoft provides. This paradigm has gone on long enough. What can I do to promote Firefox as the premier Browser for all platforms. For example, instead of syncing my contacts and required to use Google on Android devices. How can we get to the point of being able to use Firefox and ditch Google when I buy an Android phone?

content: Ciao, da diversi giorni non riesco più a visitare il sito de Il resto del carlino: <www.ilrestodelcarlino.it> con la mia versione 78.15.0esr (64 bit) per macOS 10.11.6 El Capitan. creator: egiyanr7

title: Wrong characters after restarting computer
content:
After re-starting my iMac the wrong characters appear for non-letter characters such as punctuation, which you can see in the screenshot from the pocket recommendations on the home page, where the issue doesn't appear too bad, but in practice trying to use any site with form inputs asking for email addresses etc. is impossible.

This has happened in the past and I have somehow been able to fix it, but this time nothing I've done helps. (It's only ever Firefox that is affected.)

I have deleted the app and re-installed it. I have cleared cache and cookies. I have cleared all browser history etc. I have tried changing fonts from the defaults. I'm not sure there are any other troubleshooting steps I can take.

I'm using FF developer edition, current version (just re-installed it, but it is always up-to-date, and this has been happening for a year or two). MacOS 12.6.3.

I'm a long-time FF user and until now I've lived with this inconvenience as I've somehow fixed it after troubleshooting steps, but this time I can't stumble upon the solution.
creator: nigel.m.anderson

title: Different math symbol display (LaTeX) depending on color settings
content:
Goog morning, 

                        I would like to point out the following issue. I have with Firefox 109.0.1 on Linux Kubuntu 22.04 a display problem on the page

https://www.lmfdb.org/NumberField/2.0.4.1

Right at the bottom is some "LaTeX code" text which is displayed in two different ways:

1) If I leave the default settings for the colors it is "p ≢3 (mod 4)"

2) If, as in my case, I set the background color as gray (to have less brightness "shot" on the eyes) and I tell Firefox to use the personal settings "always" instead it is "p ≡ 3 (mod 4) "

Note that, selecting the LaTeX text and copying it somewhere else, I get $p\not\equiv 3\pmod 4$, so the "negation bar" is actually present: I don't understand the reason of this behavior and how to manage it.

Thank you in advance, best regards.

Alberto Zanoni
creator: profzano

title: I can't access my accounts.
content: When I try to log into my firefox account, it asks for 2FA, which I do not have. I have a secondary email set up and when I try to log in with it, it just tells me to use my main account to sign in. I don't care if I lose my passwords that are synced to my account, but I believe someone is using my accounts to track me online. I have access to both of my e-mails but It will not send me a reset link for 2FA, it just asks me to provide a 10 digit recovery number which I never even set up. I have the password for my accounts, and access to both of my e-mails, the only thing I do not have access to is the 2FA that someone else set up.

content:
Hey there,

My email is behind 50 random characters, and the password is stored in my Firefox account- my default password manager. Ergo, I cannot access it or any of my email accounts. I have bills to pay.

If I lose these accounts, I am screwed. I can give you my password, identification, and nearly all the websites I have passwords saved for.

Please help me, and thank you.

title: Vocês venceram, hoje é meu último dia de vida. Parabéns por serem responsáveis diretos por um suicídio causado por retaliação de uma empresa.
content: Declaro o Mozilla vencedor dessa disputa. Venceram, me hackearam, fizeram uma desgraça com a minha vida por causa de críticas e busca de soluções com tantas atualizações que pioraram tudo. Cinco anos depois, vocês venceram. Hoje eu tiro minha vida graças a vocês, Mozilla Firefox. Hoje o tiro na minha testa tem razão e foram as tratativas de retaliar minha pessoa de maneira pessoal. Orgulhem-se que essa morte é na conta de cada funcionário que agiu contra minha pessoa ao invés de se questionar por que tantas atualizações. Mais de 20 em menos de 14 dias por exemplo. Agora não adianta mais Não adianta fazer funcionar, não adianta nada É o fim da minha linha Parabéns por matarem alguém, o desejo de vocês aconteceu

title: Mais atualizações, agora só consigo clicar no site do Mozilla. Qualquer outro site estou impedido de clicar.

Simplesmente a atualização mais recente me impede de clicar em qualquer coisa no navegador que não seja ligado ao Mozilla. Parece brincadeira mas não é! Essas últimas 4 atualizações melhoraram em quê? Melhoraram o mesmo que os últimos 5 anos de atualizações, NADA.
